fields.value: Replication Data for: Dynamic vs. static social networks in models of parasite transmission: Predicting Cryptosporidium spread in wild lemurs

authorAffiliation.value: Institute for Parasitology, University of Veterinary Medicine Hannover
Behavioral Ecology and Sociobiology Unit, German Primate Center
Evolutionary Anthropology and The Duke Global Health Institute, Duke University

dsDescriptionValue.value: This dataset contains the R codes, model input data and model output necessary to reproduce the analyses persented in "Dynamic vs. static social networks in models of parasite transmission: Predicting Cryptosporidium spread in wild lemurs".

files.description: Matrices of pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for each of 5 two-weekly intervals in the dry season.
files.label: 2weekly_BC_matrices_dry_season.xlsx

dataFile.description: Matrices of pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for each of 5 two-weekly intervals in the dry season.

files.description: Matrices of pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for each of 5 two-weekly intervals in the wet season.
files.label: 2weekly_BC_matrices_wet_season.xlsx

dataFile.description: Matrices of pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for each of 5 two-weekly intervals in the wet season.

files.description:
Home range sizes (in hectare) of 8 groups of Verreaux’s sifakas, for each of 5 two-weekly intervals in the dry season.
HR = home range
Group = resident group in this home range
HR_size = size of the entire home range (95 % kernel) in hectare
Core_area = size of the core area (50 % kernel) in hectare
Non_core = HR_size – core_area
HR_size_mean = mean size of the entire home range (95 % kernel) over the dry / wet season
Core_area_mean = mean size of core area (50 % kernel) over the dry / wet season
Non_core_mean = HR_size_mean – core_area_mean
files.label: 2weekly_home_range_sizes_dry.tab

files.description: Matrix of mean pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for the dry season. Input for the static network model.
files.label: Body_contact_static_dry_season.xlsx

dataFile.description: Matrix of mean pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for the dry season. Input for the static network model.

files.description: Matrix of mean pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for the wet season. Input for the static network model.

dataFile.description: Matrix of mean pairwise body contact rates (in minutes per hour) between individual Verreaux’s sifakas, for the wet season. Input for the static network model.

files.description:
Table containing parameter combinations used as well as output of the dynamic, dry season version of the Cryptosporidium model, including environmental transmission only.

Inc_period = incubation period
Beta_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_env_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and environmental transmission
Gamma_x/Gamma_y/Gamma_z = Probability of recovery for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Alpha_x/Alpha_y/Alpha_z = Probability of dying from the disease for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Half_life = Half-life of Cryptosporidium oocysts in the environment
Outbreak_size = sum of animals that had been infected until day 70 of the simulation
Groups_affected = number of groups that had been infected by the pathogen until day 70 of the simulation
Deaths = number of deaths that occurred until day 70 of the simulation
Indexcase = first animals infected in the simulation
files.label: dynamic_environmental_spread_only_dry_season.tab

files.description: A list of individual Verreaux’s sifakas present in the dry season, their membership in each of eight groups, and their age class (1 = < 1 year, 2 = 1-5 years, 3 = > 5 years of age) as well as their infection status (which will be updated throughout the model simulations).
files.label: list_of_individuals_dry_season.tab

dataFile.description: A list of individual Verreaux’s sifakas present in the dry season, their membership in each of eight groups, and their age class (1 = < 1 year, 2 = 1-5 years, 3 = > 5 years of age) as well as their infection status (which will be updated throughout the model simulations).

files.label: list_of_individuals_wet_season.tab

dataFile.description: A list of individual Verreaux’s sifakas present in the wet season, their membership in each of eight groups, and their age class (1 = < 1 year, 2 = 1-5 years, 3 = > 5 years of age) as well as their infection status (which will be updated throughout the model simulations).

files.description: SIR model code used to assess the spread of a hypothetical disease through randomly generated dynamic networks of 4 social groups and their static approximations.
files.label: random_networks_4groups_simulations.R

dataFile.description: R code used to model Cryptosporidium spread through a sifaka population during the wet season, using an SEIR model and static networks.

files.description:
Table containing parameters used, network characteristics and output for the dynamic model based on simulated networks, for simulations with beta and gamma held constant.

N = length of the network sample used in each simulation
Intergroup_weight = weight assigned to intergroup connections 
Beta = transmission probability
Gamma = probability of recovery
Rewiring_rel = relative frequency of rewiring in the dynamic version of the simulations
Mean_outbreak_size = mean relative outbreak size of the 30 simulations (proportion)
Range_weights = range of mean tie weights in the dynamic version of the simulations
files.label: Simulated_networks_model_dynamic_beta_gamma_constant1.tab

files.description:
Table containing parameters used, network characteristics and model output for the model based on simulated networks, for simulations exploring the full range of parameters 

N = length of the network sample used in each simulation
Intergroup_weight = weight assigned to intergroup connections 
Beta = transmission probability
Gamma = probability of recovery
Rewiring_rel = relative frequency of rewiring in the dynamic version of the simulations
Range_weights = range of mean tie weights in the dynamic version of the simulations
Mean_outbreak_sizeD = mean relative outbreak size of the 30 simulations based on dynamic networks (proportion)
Mean_outbreak_sizeS = mean relative outbreak size of the 30 simulations based on the static network (proportion)
Stat_density = Density of the static network
Stat_mod = Modularity of the static network
Mean_tie_strengthS = mean tie strength of the static network
Delta_mean_outbr_size =  Mean_outbreak_sizeS - Mean_outbreak_sizeD
files.label: Simulated_networks_model_full_param_ranges.tab

dataFile.description:

Gamma = probability of recovery
Rewiring_rel = relative frequency of rewiring in the dynamic version of the simulations
Range_weights = range of mean tie weights in the dynamic version of the simulations
Mean_outbreak_sizeD = mean relative outbreak size of the 30 simulations based on dynamic networks (proportion)
Mean_outbreak_sizeS = mean relative outbreak size of the 30 simulations based on the static network (proportion)
Stat_density = Density of the static network
Stat_mod = Modularity of the static network
Mean_tie_strengthS = mean tie strength of the static network
Delta_mean_outbr_size =  Mean_outbreak_sizeS - Mean_outbreak_sizeD

files.description:
Table containing parameter combinations used as well as output of the static Cryptosporidium model version including only environmental transmission,  for the dry season. 

Inc_period = incubation period
Beta_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_env_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and environmental transmission
Gamma_x/Gamma_y/Gamma_z = Probability of recovery for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Alpha_x/Alpha_y/Alpha_z = Probability of dying from the disease for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Half_life = Half-life of Cryptosporidium oocysts in the environment
Outbreak_size = sum of animals that had been infected until day 70 of the simulation
Groups_affected = number of groups that had been infected by the pathogen until day 70 of the simulation
Deaths = number of deaths that occurred until day 70 of the simulation
Indexcase = first animals infected in the simulation
files.label: static_environmental_spread_only_dry_season.tab

files.description:
Mean home range sizes (in hectare) of 8 groups of Verreaux’s sifakas in the dry season.
HR = home range
Group = resident group in this home range
HR_size = size of the entire home range (95 % kernel) in hectare
Core_area = size of the core area (50 % kernel) in hectare
Non_core = HR_size – core_area
HR_size_mean = mean size of the entire home range (95 % kernel) over the dry / wet season
Core_area_mean = mean size of core area (50 % kernel) over the dry / wet season
Non_core_mean = HR_size_mean – core_area_mean
files.label: Static_home_range_sizes_dry.tab

files.label: static_social_spread_only_dry_season.tab

dataFile.description:
Table containing parameter combinations used as well as output of the static Cryptosporidium model version including only direct contact transmission,  for the dry season. 

Inc_period = incubation period
Beta_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and direct contact transmission
Beta_env_x = transmission parameter beta for animals < 1 year of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_y = transmission parameter beta for animals between 1-5 years of age and environmental transmission
Beta_env_z = transmission parameter beta for animals >5 years of age and environmental transmission
Gamma_x/Gamma_y/Gamma_z = Probability of recovery for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Alpha_x/Alpha_y/Alpha_z = Probability of dying from the disease for animals < 1 year, 1-5 years and >5 years of age, respectively
Half_life = Half-life of Cryptosporidium oocysts in the environment
Outbreak_size = sum of animals that had been infected until day 70 of the simulation
Groups_affected = number of groups that had been infected by the pathogen until day 70 of the simulation
Deaths = number of deaths that occurred until day 70 of the simulation
Indexcase = first animals infected in the simulation
